newsitem.title: USA: Cargolux says using new planes cost-effective.
newsitem.headline: Cargolux says using new planes cost-effective.

text.p: The president of Cargolux Airlines International Wednesday said his company's use of new aircraft, versus the older craft preferred by most all-cargo airlines, is cost-effective.
"The cost advantages are very evident for us," Heiner Wilkens, president of Cargolux, told the Cargo Facts Used Aircraft symposium.
Cargolux, the fifth-largest European airfreighter company, saves 30 percent on crew costs and 60 percent on maintenance costs using new Boeing Co 747s, compared with used aircraft, Wilkens said.
He said the Luxembourg-based firm saves 17 percent on fuel costs and 15 percent on handling, landling and overflight costs by using new equipment.
"This aircraft makes money in our company," he said.
A new aircraft typically costs $150 million or more.
